column5: I was thinking about jigging for walleye this weekend and was wondering if there is a color of jigs that you find works best during this time of year? or does color not matter?  Thanks in Advance
I like white jig and grub combos year round with yellow a close second. Gotta match the hatch.
I have luck with Yellow, White, Chartreuse, Black,Orange(or a combination of two), so I would imagine any color would work.
I like White/White, White and pink/White and also I've been doing good with chartreuse head and chartreuse with silver flake twin tails.

Bait fish are most species food supply this time of year, in a tube I go with white and silver fleck for a touch of flash. Grub, white and white head, in a bait like a sassy shad white or silver with a darker back and black jighead.  Fire tiger which kind of matches small perch can also work, perch are bait fish to any thing bigger.

I seem to have better luck with white jigs. I use the Gulp 3" shad minnow and caught a nice 2 - 3 pound fish the other night and lost 2 around the same size due to not having a net on me. Should also mention i catch a lot and I mean a lot of smallmouth with this rig sometimes taking away from my pickerel fishing.
Gold "eyeball" jig head from Northland with a YUM smoke with silver flake grub. Good luck! Jim
thanks for your input everyone, hopefully i can get into some walleye tomorrow
